title: CIRCA
content:
A flea circus one!   
   
Its my first attempt in Display pixel-Woodtype   
And its probably one of the most experimental.   
   
I know that some characters have legibility problems at hit real size in screen but, please i need your different points of view, so critique!!   
   
 ![Circa.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424022533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/1945.jpg)
author: Miguel Hernandez

comments.content: haha! Very nice, I read "Quick drown fox" at first... Other than that, wonderful!

Well done! I like it.   
   
My comments:   
- "L" right slab seems too high   
- "W" can be "more wide"(excuse my english)   
- "X" and "2" are strange...   
   
But all the other letters are really nice!   
   
greg

wow   
   
so nice...   
   
agreeing about the 'L' and "W".. also the "6" seems a little weird   
   
the 'C' might have the same problem as the "L", but maybe not... I really like the little curl at the end of the "R"   
   
your work has such a terrific sheen to it... reminds me of netbabyworld in that respect   
   
very nice!
wow this rocks. one of the best pixel fonts ive seen.

What a great type. I really like it...   
( Somehow it reminds me of those classic fonts,   
used in the C64 computer games back then, which   
is nice too... )

Ok guys, i fix some problems now i think that i am very close to finish it ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424022533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
 I decide to put here an example of this font in a simple design, with some color so you can look better now, because i think that are too many details that are not much apreciate on this size(100%)so if you are agree with me, it works better for print, well i hope you can read every single character in screen & add your critique or comment, i wil apreciate a lot, thanks   
MH   
   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424022533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/7799.gif)
